member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.ViewFeatures.HtmlHelper.ObjectToDictionary(System.Object)
member.summary:
Creates a dictionary from an object, by adding each public instance property as a key with its associated value to the dictionary. It will expose public properties from derived types as well. This is typically used with objects of an anonymous type.
If the is already an instance, then it is returned as-is.
new { data_name="value" } will translate to the entry { "data_name", "value" } in the resulting dictionary.
member.param: The to be converted.
member.returns: The created dictionary of property names and property values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc.ViewFeatures.HtmlHelper.AnonymousObjectToHtmlAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary:
Creates a dictionary of HTML attributes from the input object, translating underscores to dashes in each public instance property.
If the object is already an instance, then it is returned as-is.
new { data_name="value" } will translate to the entry { "data-name", "value" } in the resulting dictionary.
member.param: Anonymous object describing HTML attributes.
member.returns: A dictionary that represents HTML attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.PropertyHelper.ObjectToDictionary(System.Object)
member.summary:
Given an object, adds each instance property with a public get method as a key and its associated value to a dictionary.
If the object is already an instance, then a copy is returned.
member.remarks: The implementation of PropertyHelper will cache the property accessors per-type. This is faster when the the same type is used multiple times with ObjectToDictionary.
